alert.note: Alert for Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 15 at 7:56AM EST until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Greenville County in upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 748 AM EST, High levels of runoff continued after a 2.5 to 3 inch rainfall. Remain wary of flooding of low-lying areas throughout the Reedy River and Brushy Creek basins. Flooding includes, but is not limited to the Swamp Rabbit Trail, Richland Creek, Cleveland Park and Lakehurst St, and possibly Long Branch near Westside Park. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville, Berea, Five Forks, Welcome, Travelers Rest, Cherrydale Point, Paris Mountain State Park, Furman University and Donaldson Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
